description: Number of orbits of length n under the map whose periodic points are counted by A047863.
references: Yash Puri and Thomas Ward, A dynamical property unique to the Lucas sequence, Fibonacci Quarterly, Volume 39, Number 5 (November 2001), pp. 398-402.
links: Y. Puri and T. Ward, Arithmetic and growth of periodic orbits, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 4 (2001), #01.2.1.
formula: If b(n) is the (n+1)-th term of A047863, then the n-th term is a(n) = (1/n)* Sum_{ d divides n }\mu(d)b(n/d)
example: a(5)=288 since the 6th term of A047863 is 1442 and the 2nd term is 2, so there must be (1442-2)/5 = 288 orbits of length 5.
author: Thomas Ward (t.ward(AT)uea.ac.uk), Mar 21 2001
